content.description: Climb the face between the outside corner and the dihedral.
content.location: Just left of the dihedral on the right and of the wall.

climbs.name: Once Upon a Dime
climbs.fa: John Long, Lynn Hill, Richard Harrison

content.description: Start as for the Right Boulder Crack and climbs the water streak with a wrinkled top just to the right. Make two or three moves till you can traverse right on a right angling seam and then fancy footwork straight up the water streak.
content.location: The center of the Front Boulder Wall.

content.description: Climb the right side of the crack in the middle of the wall. The crux is gaining the small crescent edge. This climb has been bouldered and led and is the benchmark for 5.9 at Keyhole.
content.protection: Top rope or brass nuts, small cams, ball nuts
content.location: The right side of the crack in the middle of the 30' Wall.

content.protection: Slings and gear for top roping.
content.location: The right side of the 30' Wall.

content.description: Climb the left side of the crack in the middle of the wall up past the small crescent edge. The crux is reaching the other crack. This climb has been led.
content.protection: Top rope, or brass nuts, micro cams, ball nuts
content.location: The left side of the crack in the middle of the Front Boulder Wall.

content.description: A tips to hands crack with the crux just under halfway. Belay with gear.
content.location: On the left side of the 30' wall just up onto the talus.

content.description:
The 30 Foot Wall is the east-facing cliff on the right as you first walk into the canyon. Everything here is bouldered or top roped, a few can be led. There are no bolts on this cliff; all anchors are made with gear. Extra sling or a rope is needed to get top rope anchor points over the edge. Petroglyphs are on the blackened varnished backside, so make sure to avoid them when accessing the top this way.

 Edited for historical accuracy: Front Bouldering Wall is the correct name for this cliff. The name "30 Foot Wall" was added by later climbers.
